Nightshift quickly drinks the medication and loads up his dart launcher on =
his right shoulder.

" Something tells me I might have ta use this."

Sent =
from my iPhone

On Jun 17, 2011, at 6:32 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@=
gmail.com> wrote:

>> <OLD>
>> 
>> Nightshift tries to shift his body in a =
more comfortable position.  Now that
>> Ramulus had done some repairs, he c=
ould feel his lower body again.
>> Unfortunately the pain of his injuries w=
ere now catching up to him.
>> 
>> "Ugh,slag, maybe I'd be better off if I =
couldn't feel anything. This really
>> hurts now."
>> 
>> Grunts Nightshift=
 as he stays still to avoid making things too painful for
>> himself.
>> 
>=
> "Maybe trad'n in the wheels for paws might not be such a bad idea after
>=
> all."
> 
> <NEW>

> RAMULUS nodded as he watched NIGHTSHIFT in pain, th=
ere was a reflected
> pain in his own face. It was obvious that he hated to=

> companions in pain. Reaching into his pack he brought out=

e .    .    .

oning to RAT TRAP and NIGHTSHIFT for silence

lmost like a human heart beat.

oking around the cave RAMULUS didn=E2=80=99t see anything that might be

ausing it. Then he noticed the sounds of the birds chirping and the

s of the background wild life had vanished, even the rustling of

squerrels had stopped.
>

ls of water that were towards

f the storm that had just

 cave.

d his findings to the

ly something quite
